## Training Overview

This intensive 1-day workshop transforms your team members into active defenders of your organization's security. Focused on practical, accessible security awareness training, this program addresses the human element of security—often the most vulnerable aspect of any organization's defenses. Participants will learn to recognize threats, implement basic security practices, and contribute to a security-conscious workplace culture.

### Next Session

- **Date:** August 15, 2025
- **Times:** 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
- **Format:** Available in-person or live virtual
- **Prerequisites:** None - designed for all staff members
- **Price:** $495 per participant (includes materials, lunch for in-person attendees, and 90-day access to security awareness resources)

## Training Curriculum

### Morning Session: Understanding Security Threats

**Introduction to Security Awareness (9:00 - 10:30)**
- Why human behavior is central to security
- Common threat actors and their motivations
- The cost of security incidents to organizations
- Security as everyone's responsibility
- Interactive exercise: Security misconceptions quiz

**Social Engineering and Phishing (10:45 - 12:30)**
- Understanding social engineering tactics
- Recognizing phishing attempts across channels (email, voice, text)
- Real-world phishing examples and case studies
- Red flags and warning signs
- Hands-on exercise: Phishing email identification challenge

### Afternoon Session: Building Security Habits

**Essential Security Practices (1:30 - 3:00)**
- Password management and multi-factor authentication
- Safe browsing and email habits
- Mobile device security essentials
- Physical security awareness
- Secure remote work practices
- Hands-on exercise: Password strength assessment and improvement

**Creating a Security Culture (3:15 - 5:00)**
- Reporting security incidents promptly
- Communicating about security effectively
- Overcoming barriers to security compliance
- Supporting colleagues with security practices
- Action planning for team security improvements
- Hands-on exercise: Team security incident response simulation

## Learning Outcomes

By completing this training, participants will be able to:

- Identify common social engineering and phishing techniques
- Apply strong password management and authentication practices
- Practice safe browsing and email habits
- Secure their physical and digital workspaces
- Recognize and report security incidents promptly
- Contribute positively to the organization's security culture
- Implement personal action plans for improved security habits

## Who Should Attend

This training is designed for:

- All employees in organizations handling sensitive data
- Teams who want to build a stronger security culture
- New employees as part of onboarding
- Staff who may be targeted by phishing or social engineering
- Remote workers who need to implement security practices independently
- Customer-facing employees who handle sensitive information

No technical background is required - this training is accessible to staff at all technical levels.

## Materials and Resources

Participants will receive:

- Digital security awareness handbook
- Phishing identification quick reference guide
- Password management tools guide
- Security incident reporting templates
- 90-day access to our security awareness resource portal
- Certificate of completion
- Regular security awareness refreshers via email
